contextId.information: Jotham offered the possibility that what they did was good, but Jotham does not actually believe what they did was good. AT: "if you have done what is right and Jerub Baal deserved for you to kill all of his sons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
contextId.quote: if you have done well concerning Jerub Baal and his house, and if you have punished him as he deserves

contextId.information: Jotham offered the possibility that what they did was good, but Jotham does not actually believe what they did was good. AT: "If you treated Jerub Baal and his family as they deserved to be treated" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
contextId.quote: If you acted with honesty and integrity with Jerub Baal and his house

contextId.information: Jotham offered the opposite possibility that what they did was evil and applied a curse. Jotham does believe what they did was evil. AT: "But if you treated Jerub Baal and his family as they did not deserve to be treated" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
